2.text: No doubt but you are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.

3.text: But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you: yes, who knows not such things as these?

4.text: I am as one mocked of his neighbor, who calls on God, and he answers him: the just upright man is laughed to scorn.

5.text: He that is ready to slip with his feet is as a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.

6.text: The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God brings abundantly.

7.text: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach you; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell you:

8.text: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach you: and the fishes of the sea shall declare to you.

9.text: Who knows not in all these that the hand of the LORD has worked this?

10.text: In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.

11.text: Does not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat?

12.text: With the ancient is wisdom; and in length of days understanding.

13.text: With him is wisdom and strength, he has counsel and understanding.

14.text: Behold, he breaks down, and it cannot be built again: he shuts up a man, and there can be no opening.

15.text: Behold, he withholds the waters, and they dry up: also he sends them out, and they overturn the earth.

16.text: With him is strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver are his.

17.text: He leads counsellors away spoiled, and makes the judges fools.

18.text: He looses the bond of kings, and girds their loins with a girdle.

19.text: He leads princes away spoiled, and overthrows the mighty.

20.text: He removes away the speech of the trusty, and takes away the understanding of the aged.

21.text: He pours contempt on princes, and weakens the strength of the mighty.

22.text: He discovers deep things out of darkness, and brings out to light the shadow of death.

23.text: He increases the nations, and destroys them: he enlarges the nations, and straitens them again.

24.text: He takes away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causes them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.

25.text: They grope in the dark without light, and he makes them to stagger like a drunken man.
